body:
Hello Avicus Community!

JKawesome hosted once an Avicus YAML to XML converter. As most of you know, JKawesome left Avicus and Minecraft. But he still had the source codes for the converter. Right now, I'm hosting them.

How it works:
You will copy the .yml source code from http://maps.avicus.net to the left-side of the webpage, and you will get the converted xml code at the right side. You can copy it with clicking with the mouse once on the code, pressing CTRL+A together and CTRL+C to copy it.

Hosts:
http://vps01.atdit.de/tools/yml2xml/ or http://yaml2xml.tk
http://vps02.atdit.de/tools/yml2xml/ or http://yml2xml.tk
http://atdit.de/tools/yml2xml/ or http://yamltoxml.tk
http://dephipseschgschold.ch/tools/yml2xml/ or http://ymltoxml.tk

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
All credits belong to JKawesome/Hacktivism for coding!
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

I hope it's helpful and you can use it.
I might make a tutorial which explains how to setup a scrim server with Avicus maps, depending on how many people need it.

Greetings,
Atdit

title: YAML to XML Converter by JKawesome

replies.body:
already copied a YAML code and idk how to convert

so,thanks,very useful

replies.body:
Hey! Thanks for re-producing this to Avicus! Whats the point of it? Because what sinario will we need to translate yml to xml? I just dont see the point.

JKAwesome will be remembered!
replies.body_tagged:
Hey! Thanks for re-producing this to Avicus! Whats the point of it? Because what sinario will we need to translate yml to xml? I just dont see the point.

JKAwesome will be remembered!

replies.body: Avicus uses yml which is a private system afaik. XML is used for personal servers, its very useful.
